verses.roman:
jagannāthera punaḥ pāṇḍu-vijaya ha-ila
eka guṭi paṭṭa-ḍorī tāṅhā ṭuṭi' gela

synonyms: jagannāthera—of Lord Jagannātha; punaḥ—again; pāṇḍu-vijaya—the function of carrying the Lord; ha-ila—there was; eka guṭi—one bunch; paṭṭa-ḍorī—ropes of silk; tāṅhā—there; ṭuṭi' gela—broke.
translation: During the Pāṇḍu-vijaya, Lord Jagannātha was carried, and while He was being carried, a bunch of silken ropes broke.
